The first part of the following theorem relates the principal pivot transform to the pivot operation on a graph. The second part establishes that the interlace polynomial of a matrix satisfies a recurrence that, by the first part, generalizes the recurrence for the interlace polynomial of a graph. We will write $A \setminus v$ for the submatrix $A_{V \setminus \{v\}}$.

\begin{theorem} \label{thm:adjacencypivot} \
\begin{enumerate}
